body:
Hi Andrew! I'm new to Ladybug and so far I've been able to achieve a lot by reading through the forum. Please excuse me if I am wrong when asking.
I've been trying to get your "Mesh to Illustrator" to work, but I guess there is something I am doing wrong. The hatches I get after baking are "open surface" and all of them are black, I am not getting the radiation color. Here are some screenshots of my project. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/jEI2iEfKUOgAhtpAcwvCSArUzc*du1U2O3g8fMDMrEPR*sAljRe5vKFIbFSGN5AhfBuyZvIUKR9vgBSHXvMXlhfuKydy*7mw/grasshopper.png) The first one shows how I have attached the components, just like your example. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/jEI2iEfKUOhRqBvzvhTssycukSJSMvfFrGNRMhDv6zmNG9Uw*x80Qdb9rINS*GnyYK30NdB75KwvPRwL7IJES15y5DuQAKP-/Mcol.png) The second one shows the preview component in gh (left) and rhino (right) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/jEI2iEfKUOg04iL0JxFn26DlQhmJc3TS3tOV0Pl9LOgkiJa0QHD2a*UaWquy8RBFP0PgOmg3q1Qr0G4q7zNSNBAcXt9cS8h*/rhino.png) The third one shows the radiation mesh (right) and the result of the pseudo-make2D hatches (left) Any idea of what I am doing wrong? Thank you!!
